Comments_List: On any given week, I spent between 20-30 hours working on this research.

Lots of self-learning of quantitative concepts, which was not really a consequence of my specific research mentor but rather my (lack of math) background. Overall, I learned a ton about modeling: its utility, how to create my own (!), etc.
The Wizard was as helpful as ever in orchestrating this rotation and checking up on us.
Great opportunity to do research with faculty.
Highly recommend a rotation in modeling if you're remotely interested as an EMD student.
